data.title: Great bar
data.text: The food is supposed to be amazing. We stopped in for drinks only on a college football Saturday. Great crowd great service and great prices. Next time we are in town we plan to stop again and eat.

data.title: Great Seafood
data.text: Very quaint local place got the Captain Platter and Calamari appetizer and a couple of drinks for I thought was a great price! Service was excellent and so was food,

data.title: Fun Bar in the heart of VA Beach
data.text:
It's a fairly easy bar to find, but parking can get tricky when it's peak times.  Happy hour here is amazing.  Good selection of beers (domestics and some micro as well) and bar food.  The wings are amazing - you have to wait once ordering as they are cooked to order.  Mussels were very good and served in almost a one fish bouillabaisse.  Steamed shrimp were like little pink debutants dressed in their finest - bay seasoning and celery with an adequate cocktail sauce.  Tuesday's are the best deal in town where after 5, you can get 1 and a 1/2 pounds of snow crab!!!

We will be back for more fun, food, and beer on our next visit.

data.title: This place is hopping
data.text: Very crowded on a not so crowded weekend.  Obviously the place to go.  Atmosphere is casual and fun.  Bartenders are very friendly and accommodating.  Had the wings and  buffalo shrimp.   Both were very tasty.  Will visit again on my next trip to VB, VA.

data.title: Best Sports Bar In Va. Beach
data.text: If You Want A Friendly Sports Bar With An Exemplary Menu Then Look No Further!!! The Staff Is Wonderful And Odds Are Your Waiter Or Bartender Is Going To Be One Of The Owners!! The Menu Is Very Diverse The Atmosphere Is Extremely Friendly!! This Is Definitely A Must Go To Restaurant When Staying In Va. Beach

data.title: Good bar to watch games on TV
data.text: Good bar to grab a seaside bar food and a few drinks and watch the games on TV in the afternoons or nights.  Plenty of space inside or outside, the prices are reasonable and the service is good.

data.title: Fun friendly local bar with great TV's for watching sports
data.text: Went here for first time with a friend to watch Monday Night FB.  Bartender was friendly and attentive.  Highly recommend this spot for drinks, bar food and sporting events

data.title: Good Bar Food
data.text: Ate lunch on the porch. Better than eating inside but there is no view to speak of. Our server Lauren did a fine job. Cold drinks. Pretty good peel and eat shrimp. Very good oysters Rockefeller.

data.title: Good fish and chips
data.text:
Fish and chips were good and the price was reasonable. The portion was not large, but the breading was light and they were relatively crispy.

Fries were good.

Salad was very basic, but the blue cheese salad dressing was outstanding.

Service was reasonable.

data.title: Superlative
data.text:
you just can't go wrong with this place.  Late afternoon visit on a Thursday so place was reasonably quiet.

Tuna steak was really good and larger than tuna steaks in other places around Oceanfront.  Steamed shrimp were $7.99 a pound during happy hour.  They were steamed with celery and some spices.  Thick and juicy.

Our waitress, Veda, was knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive.  Always a pleasure to visit, very good food, reasonable prices and attentive service.

data.title: The best seafood!
data.text:
After being disappointed by a neighboring restaurant, (who refused to deliver service as promised), we came upon this restaurant, on our long walk back to our motel room-BOY, ARE WE GLAD WE STOPPED IN! Definitely a sports bar (not a first choice for us), but the seafood we had was AMAZING! 
Recommend the calamari, the crab appetizer, the fish and chips-everythivg was delicious-our server was helpful, without hovering: hope to get back for seconds before we go home!

data.title: Still Awesome
data.text: Everything about this place is great.  I prefer the outdoor seating, food is amazing and the service is exceptional.  Grewat place to kick back watch a ball game, listen to some music and gorge yourself on good seafood and cold beer.

data.title: Awesome, as usual!!!
data.text: So good. Food, shrimp, crablegs and mussels! Great bartender (Adam) with great adult beverages for all!!!! Super fun night-Stuffed!

data.title: Still one of the best
data.text: Shuckers is The place to go for happy hour wings and peel and eat shrimp.  The shrimp are large and crunchy with great seasoning and they bring butter, shrimp sauce and celery and they are $7 per 1/2 pound!  Ask to have the wings finished on the grill and they are delicious as well.  We were seated inside upstairs and it was nice and cool, roomy and even had its own rest room.  Definitely a favorite!

data.title: Outdoor Patio With Live Music
data.text: My husband and I are visiting local friends who took us here again.  We visited last Memorial Day as well.  We enjoyed socializing with our friends, a group of 6, on the outdoor patio where live music was very good!  The drink and food menu offered something for everyone and our service was fast and friendly.  It's a laid-back, relaxing, informal place which is comfortable.

data.title: Hoppin Place
data.text: Great drinks, very young crowd, service was excellent, and the atmosphere is very lively. Great local spot.

data.title: SO YUMMY
data.text: We were in VB for 8 days and tried multiple restaurants, we came here twice.  I could have easily eaten here every day. Absolutely delicious !!!!! Service was incredible both times.  Eat the wings and the fish tacos. Don't forget the oysters! Can't say enough about this place.  They should be number 1!!!

data.title: Monday wing night
data.text: We had dinner at CP Shucker's on a Monday and it was wing night.  The wings were very good. Someone suggested getting them finished on the grill to put a char on the sauce.  We didn't but sounds good.  My Daughter got the crag legs and enjoyed them.  They also have a children's menu.  Our waitress was very good.

data.title: Average at best.
data.text:
Pros: food ok
Cons: booths uncomfortable, bar LOUD, service non existent.  The waitress, though nice enough forgot about us???? It took 45 minutes to get a salad, tuna and 6 oysters. I could have opened the oysters myself a lot quicker. We had to ask other waitresses to bring us cocktail sauce and more lemon. My husband said the oysters were just ok and in a place where seafood is abundant, thats an issue. Someone was singing karaoke very loudly during dinner and the bartender kept ringing the bar bell ( which I am assuming meant nice tips) but it did not make for a great meal.

data.title: Girls weekend with drinks, dinner at C P Shuckers
data.text: We went to C P Shucker's for drinks and dinner on a Saturday night recently. I got the crab legs, a generous portion, and they were delicious.  Been there before and had to go back this trip for the seafood.  Really good and would recommend.
